text.0: as with their voice from cloud they sprinkle treasure so are the wise mans liberal sacrifices.
text.1: i praise their company that merits worship as the good martits priest to pay them honour.
text.2: the youths have wrought their ornaments for glory through many nightsthis noble band of maruts.
text.3: like stags the sons of dyatis have striven onward the sons of aditi grown strong like pillars.
text.4: they who extend beyond the earth and heaven by their own mass as from the cloud spreads sūrya.
text.5: like mighty heroes covetous of glory like heavenly gallants who destroy the wicked.
text.6: when ye come nigh as in the depth of waters the earth is loosened as it were and shaken.
text.7: this your allfeedin sacrifice approaches come all united fraught as twere with viands.
text.8: ye are like horses fastened to the chariot poles luminous with your beams with splendour as at dawn.
text.9: like selfbright falcons punishers of wicked men like hovering birds urged forward scattering rain around.
text.10: when ye come forth o maruts from the distance from the great treasury of rich possessions.
text.11: knowing o vasus boons that should be granted even from afar drive back the men who hate us.
text.12: he who engaged in the rites final duty brings as a man oblation to the maruts.
text.13: wins him lifes wealthy fulness blest with heroes he shall be present too where gods drink soma.
text.14: for these are helps adored at sacrifices bringing good fortune by their name Ādityas.
text.15: speeding on cars let them protect our praises delighting in our sacrifice and worship.
